fields.description:
h3. Summary
All boards page is not loading

h3. Environment
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on {{Boards}}
# Click on {{View all boards}}

h3. Expected Results
All boards where the user have access are listed

h3. Actual Results
The page keeps loading.
Console:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'isValid' of undefined
    at Object.GH.tpl.rapid.manageboards.renderBoardRow (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-ad…:69975)
    at Object.GH.tpl.rapid.manageboards.renderBoardsTable (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-ad…:69955)
    at ManageBoardsView.renderBoards (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-ad…:69777)
    at ManageBoardsView.render (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-ad…:69754)
    at batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-ad…:3240
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at Function.b.each.b.forEach (batch.js?locale=en-US:986)
    at ManageBoardsModel.trigger (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-ad…:3238)
    at ManageBoardsModel.populate (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-ad…:69394)
    at ManageBoardsController.<anonymous> (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-ad…:69852)
﻿{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* 


h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: All boards page is not loading

fields.description:
We use basic auth for our integration:

Server URL: https://\{customer_account_name}.atlassian.net/

Username, Project key, and User password

Result:

{{Error: 400 Bad Request }}

{{We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields - If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file}} 

Most of our users are able to connect but we have a few that are getting the error. We've tested it and it seems to work for our devs. 

I'm not sure about the component.
fields.summary: JIRA integration could not connect

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues are not showing their original estimations set at issue creation when they are added to Sprints and removed from them, to subsequently being added to another Sprint.
For example, an issue estimated with 5 Story Points at the issue creation can appear in the Sprint report showing no estimation is there's a change in the Story points estimation after the issue gets removed from the Sprint and the Sprint is closed.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA issue with 5 Story points estimated at issue creation, for example (very important).
# Create a Sprint and put this issue in the Sprint.
# Start the Sprint
# Remove the issue from the Sprint
# Close the Sprint
# Change the Story points of the issue to a different one (used 1)
# Create another Sprint and add this issue to this Sprint
# Complete the issue in this Sprint and Close the Sprint.
# Open the report of the past Sprint.

h3. Expected Results
The issue should show up with the original estimated number of Story points, which's 5 in this case.

h3. Actual Results
The issue shows as a not estimated issue.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Issues appearing with no estimation when they are removed from Sprint and added in another in JIRA Reports

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Version report does not have a summary that can be used as reference for the issues appearing in the report like the Epic report does.
It would be useful for the end user if one was available.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make a copy of the one used in the Epic report.
fields.summary: Create a Summary for the Version Report like the Epic Report

fields.description:
Is it possible to display the overall number of found tickets (after filtering them)?

This option can take place somewhere near "Order by" drop down menu as it is marked in the attached picture. It will be easier to track the whole number of filtered tickets.
fields.summary: Display the overall number of found tickets

i can able to Restore data from JIRA server cloud to JIRA server application, but i am unable to get data cloud plugin to JIRA server, could please any one suggest any link or blog

Thanks in advance
fields.summary: How to import/export  jira cloud plugin data and Restore in jira Server premises

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a board filter gets invalidated, the backlog and sprint links on the board sidebar will disappear without any error message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a custom Issue type and assign it a project
2. Edit the board's filter to use the custom issue type.
{code}project = TES AND issuetype in (story, bug, CUSTOM_TYPE) ORDER BY Priority DESC{code}
3. Delete the custom issue type from the project and from JIRA. The saved filter will now be invalid.
{code}Error:  The value 'CUSTOM_TYPE' does not exist for the field 'issuetype'.{code}
4. Access the board

h3. Expected Results

Give some sort of indication that the filter is no longer valid. 

h3. Actual Results

Backlog and Active Sprint link on the sidebar  will simply disappear.

!sidebar.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
If the Backlog and Active Sprint links are missing, check the board settings and open the filter configured  in JIRA Search. Fix any error on the search filter and re-save.
fields.summary: Missing backlog and sprint links when board filter is invalid

fields.description: MIS report weekly
fields.summary: PAN INDIA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues cannot be ranked due to error {{Issue does not exist or you do not have permission to see it.}} even if the user has schedule and edit permissions on the project.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.1092.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a board (backlog or active sprint)
# Try moving an issue to another column or changing its order

h3. Expected Results
Issue is moved to the new position

h3. Actual Results
The issue remains on same position and the following error is shown:
{noformat}
Issue does not exist or you do not have permission to see it.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-resources/jira-agile-faq/what-are-the-permissions-used-in-agile-boards

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: Issues cannot be ranked

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the user log works in an issue and manually change the date of the Logged Work "Date Started" to sometime before the issue creation date, the Burndown chart won't take this Log Work into account.

h3. Environment
JIRA Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board with a Sprint and a few issues;
# Put the board estimation to be "Original Time Estimate" and enable "Time Tracking";
# Start the Sprint, edit the start date of the sprint to an earlier time to test it easily
# Log Work in an issue setting the day of this logged work to be before the issue creation, but after the sprint start date
# Select the report of Burndown with "Remaining Time Estimate" as the reference, so the "Time Spent" progress line appears

h3. Expected Results
JIRA Software burndown chart should, at least, show the logged work entry for the day it was committed.
It would be better if the burndown chart could also take into account the actual Date Started.

h3. Actual Results
The entry is not processed by the Burndown chart
* The time spent line does not indicate that time logged
* The summary below also does not capture this time logged event
 
h3.Workaround
Manually edit the start date to be after the issue creation date
fields.summary: Sprint burndown does not include "work logged"/"time spent" if date started is altered manually to be earlier than issue creation date

fields.description:
Hello!

We are finding the recent changes for administering JIRA users even harmful.
 # Not being able to change the full name anymore
 ## As we have users from different organisations or groups using our JIRA, we have used the full name field to easily mark the users's organisation from our point of view.
 # Not being able to change the email addess
 ## In this era of constant acquisitions users' email addresses often change. Since it is no longer possible to change the email address we are forced to inactivate the old user account and create a new one. As you can understand this is is really detrimental and causes all kinds of extra hassle.

3. Not being able to use same email address for two different accounts.
 * Since we do need some testing account etc, it is quite harmful that we also need separate email addresses for them.

Both of these changes are making using JIRA efficiently more and more difficult for us. We used to do all of this maintenance in the JIRA User management section.
fields.summary: Recent changes in the JIRA user maintenance
As an administrastor, I want to track the history of changes in a backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for quick filters, it's not possible to click on the 'X' icon to clear the search field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for a quick filter in the board backlog
# Click on the 'X' icon

h3. Expected Results

The search is cleared out.

h3. Actual Results

You're unable to click on the icon.


h3.Workarounds

1. Refresh the page
2. Press the Esc key
3. Backspace until the field is empty
fields.summary: 'X' icon to clear quick filter search is not working.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sprint Burndown Gadget shows up blank. Not able to choose spring board and active sprints.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Not able to reproduce in the dev environment. Please check the comments for more details.
 
h3. Notes

Gadget stopped working all of sudden, and the dashboard owner is not able to re-configure again, as the edit option is no longer visible. A few gadgets are also facing the same problem inconsitently like: 
 * Sprint Burndown
 * Agile Wallboard
 * Version Report
 * Sprint Health

h3. Workaround

No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: JIRA Software Gadgets shows up blank

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Rank is not respected if the user moves issues in batch and re-rank them below or above a specific issue in the backlog.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a SCRUM board
# Create some issues in the backlog (more than 5).
# Put at least 2 of those issues in a Sprint
# Move the other issues together to this Sprint and rank them below or above another issue already in the Sprint.
# Refresh the page.

h3. Expected Results
The order of the issues moved in the batch of issues remains the same.

h3. Actual Results
The order of the issues is altered among the ones moves in the batch.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Rank is lost when reordering chunk of issues in backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Branches named with white spaces linked with JIRA issues are causing 404 error if the user follow the link to the branch when clicking in the branch link under development panel

h3. Environment
DVCS Cloud + Bitbucket

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a branch in Bitbucket with white spaces on it.
# Link this branch with an issue in JIRA: you can use this naming example: "This is a test | <issueKey> - test"

h3. Expected Results
The link should appear in the JIRA issue and when the user clicks on it, Bitbucket should direct the user to the branch related.

h3. Actual Results
No errors in JIRA, but when the address gets redirected, the URL is malformed and a 404 error is displayed.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Branches with white spaces on it are causing 404 errors in Bitbucket redirect

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When defining the status order for an agile board in {{Configure > Column Management}} ,
the order is not reflected in the board accordingly


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an Agile Board
# {{more(...) > Board settings > Columns}} 
# Configure as below
#  !column_management.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
When viewing in the board, it should follow the order of the status configured in column management

h3. Actual Results
The order is not followed.
  !board2.png|thumbnail! 
  !kanban_view.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Status in Board Column is not in Order

fields.description:
When seeing a task, you will have the link of all associated sub-tasks under the ticket, there is a 3 dots button where you can select which sub-tasks will be displayed, the options are: 
* Show All
* Show Open
* Bulk Operation
* Open Issue Navigator

Please create a documentation so our customers can be aware of this feature.

User case: A customer was not seeing closed issues because it was selected *Show Open*, he asked for the documentation but I could not find anything related.
fields.summary: Documentation request - Feature to display which sub-tasks will be shown on the task view.

fields.description: Being able to display portfolio planning dates in JIRA issues, that way team can see it and we can also change this dates with importing features. Without this possibility, portfolio is a really limited tool because double work is needed, to change dates in JIRA and then, in Portfolio.
fields.summary: Display target start and target end dates from portfolio in Jira

fields.summary: Quick filters in Agile Wallboard Gadget

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Since Tempo has moved to a new cloud infrastructure. The data is being stored in Tempo side. With that, the *Time Spent* field is currently not retrieving data from Tempo, this is affecting Burndown Chart and Time Reports.
h2. Steps to Replicate
 # Log work using Tempo
 # Go to Burndown Chart / Time Reports

h2. Expected Result

The burndown chart / time reports should show the correct Time Spent.
h2. Current Result

Time spent field is empty
fields.summary: Time Spent field in Burndown Chart and Time Reports is not retrieving data from Tempo

fields.description:
Hi, 

I'd like to count number of transitions in JIRA Software Cloud. 

 

I have "Reopened" status for a Bug issue type and want to count how many times the bug is reopened and pull out the report with assignee and other values.  

 

I noticed that there is a related issue in JIRA Cloud project - JIRACLOUD-27794 - and it says to use plug-in. 

but the plug-in that does the job is NOT a free tool anymore. 

 

Could you please check it and develop it as a feature of JIRA Cloud? 

 

I also opened it in service desk as well. 

https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-288278
fields.summary: Transition count

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When I try to reorder an issue in backlog board, it does not give a space to sort the issue into.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JIRA Software
* Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox and Apple Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a SCRUM project
# Add many issues to its backlog
# Zoomed into 110% or less than 100%
# Drag an issue in order to sort them 

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should give a space to sort the issue into.

h3. Actual Results

It doesn’t give a space to sort the issue into, but the issue can be reordered.
 
h3. Notes

It works with the zoom at 125% or more. It works in IE 11, it does not matter how much zoom in or out.

h3.Workaround

Use browser zoom at 100% or more than 110% or use IE 11.
fields.summary: Reorder an issue in backlog board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The endpoint to update issues:
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue-editIssue

does not trigger a refresh in Agile cards.
If the field being updated is appearing in the Agile card, the field won't change until a full refresh of the page is done.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the update through REST API update the field in the Agile card just as the Issue Detail view of the board does.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: REST API Updates should trigger a refresh in Agile cards.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The burndown report has an option to select which kind of *Time Tracking* will be presented on the report. 

* Story Points 
* Original Time Estimate 
* Issue Count

The Burndown gadget, on the other hand, doesn't have an easy way through the UI to select these options. The only way to change from story points to hours is by navigating to the *Estimation* tab of the Project's *Board Settings*. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a gadget and a burndown report 
# Verify the options available for *Time Tracking* on the report 

# Add a burndown gadget on a dashboard
# There's no option to select the *Time Tracking*

h3. Ideal Results
There should be an option available on the gadget configuration to select which kind of *Time Tracking* will be presented on the gadget.  

h3. Actual Results
The user must access the estimation tab of his board settings to change this. 

*Screenshot Showing the behavior below*

 !Wrong_vertical_axis_units_in_Dashboard_2017-06-13.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The Burndown Gagdet should have an option available on the configuration settings to select which kind of Time Tracking will be presented on the gadget

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

It's not possible to make a JIRA Agile board public in JIRA Software Cloud.

*Suggested Solution*

Make it possible to a user to view the board accessing the board's URL without having to log in, by granting the Browse Project permission to _Anyone_ group and setting the board as _Shared with the public_.

*Workaround*

Access the instance's URL > Projects > View all projects > Select the project to view the issues.
fields.summary: Making a board publicly available

fields.description: When I have scrolled down in a long swimlane/column, I can't see the titles anymore and sometimes I move the cards to the wrong column. It would be nice if the title of the column stayed visible somehow when I scroll down a long column/swimlane
fields.summary: As a user, when I have a lane with lots of work, I can't see the title of the lanes when I scroll.

fields.description:
I have a lot of automated systems that report into service desk so I can easily monitor issues. This can lead to a lot of tickets being generated that I may not need. Can you please allow multi ticket closing so I can keep my queue clear.

 

Thank.
fields.summary: Allow multi close on service desk tickets

fields.description: Proyecto para creación de software de gestión de empresas
fields.summary: Servip

fields.description:
I am trying to import data from exported XML file to Word document template.

I exported the issue to an XML file, but when in Word Source manager I try to add the XML file as data source, I get the error: "This is not a bibliography source file and cannot be opened"

Am I doing something wrong or is there some error in the XML format?
fields.summary: Importing fields in Word from XML export

fields.description:
As part of JSWCLOUD-15896 we discovered that polling this API frequently was causing high load on some of the instances and response times were slow. The Agile Cards Vendor has since reduced the polling interval to once per minute which solved the immediate problem. 

We still need to investigate and improve performance of that API endpoint to cater for large instances.
fields.summary: Improve performance of /rest/agile/1.0/board/*/issue API

fields.description:
See [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/cloud/] 

Section: Pagination

Example shows:
{code}
http://host:port/context/rest/api-name/api-version/resource-name?start=0&limit=10
{code}

the url parameter 'limit' should instead be 'maxResults'
fields.summary: Pagination example is incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when you create an issue using the *+ Create issues* at the end of the sprint or backlog and select the issuetype in the arrow or select the sprint where the issue should go in *New Task in*, the page refreshes.

h3. Suggested Solution

The page should not refresh when selecting the issuetype or when selecting the sprint where the issue should go.

h3. Why this is important

Although the summary, issuetype and sprint/backlog is not lost when the page refreshes, this behavior can annoy some users.
fields.summary: "+ Create issues" feature refreshes the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to view the Kanban Boards, the board cannot be shown. Instead, it is throwing Error: ChangeHistory searching is turned off, this should not be invoked

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Boards
# Click on any of the Kanban Board

h3. Expected Results
The board is shown succesfully

h3. Actual Results
The board cannot be shown. Instead, it is throwing Error: ChangeHistory searching is turned off, this should not be invoked

h3. Work around

# Removing the historical searching parts out of the board query/filter. E.g: "WAS" clauses, "AFTER -7d" (7 days ago), etc.
# Removing "Tempo Team" clause out of the board query/filter as well, because it's supported yet.
# Disable the "show days in column"
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Kanban boards are not loading when the query has a historical search or uses "Tempo Team" JQL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When configuring Card Color via Queries, the query input field allows and appears to validate invalid JQL. This causes the board to render blank and return a 500 internal server error in the browser console.

h3. Environment
JIRA Software Cloud v1000.506.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board
# Go to Board Configuration --> Card Color
# Select Queries from the dropdown
# Use the following invalid JQL as a color definition and add it.
{code:java}component ~ component{code}

h3. Expected Results
Query input correctly identifies the JQL as invalid and prevents adding it.

h3. Actual Results
Color definition is added successfully and now the board is broken. It renders blank and returns the following 500 error in the browser console.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Boards page ({{https://example.atlassian.net/secure/ManageRapidViews.jspa}}) don't load if the username is "true"

h3. Environment
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On {{User management}}, change username to {{true}}
# Open JIRA, click on {{Boards}}

h3. Expected Results
All boards are listed

h3. Actual Results
Boards page keeps refreshing and never loads
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: Boards page don't load if the username is "true"

fields.description:
Would be great and more mobile friendly to allow for comments to be made via a recorded voice message as an alternative to entering comments as a text.

 

Similar suggestion to : https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/HCPUB-2848
fields.summary: Implement voice message as an alternative to text comment

fields.description:
h3. Problem
If the name of a release is not short it gets truncated and makes it harder to read the board

h3. Suggestion
Make the release field larger

h3. Workaround
Click on the issue and look at the detailed view
fields.summary: Make the release column in the boards larger

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When deleting an active sprint, there's only a confirmation message.

h3. Suggested Solution
It should warn users that this is an active sprint

h3. Why this is important
* To make sure users are aware of Sprint
* To prevent users accidentally delete an Active Sprint as this will affect their reports
fields.summary: Warning Message for Deleting an Active Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there aren't Story labels in JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create Story labels just like the Epic labels.

h3. Why this is important

Same users find the Epic Title will show on the story card very useful and would like the same for Stories.
fields.summary: Story labels

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you close a sprint and at the following seconds you start the new sprint, JIRA understands that you have started the new sprint some seconds after the previous sprint closure. This can reflect in Burndown Chart showing a bunch of issues added to the sprint shortly after it began.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Close *Sprint_A* at Wed May 31 2017 10:*25*;
* Wait some seconds;
* Start *Sprint_B* at the same minute (Wed May 30 2017 10:*25*);


h3. Expected Results

* Complete date and start date registered in JIRA with the exact time these actions occurred.

h3. Actual Results

* Complete date for *Sprint_A* shows in the database as
Wed May 31 2017 10:25:*14* and start date for *Sprint_B* shows in the database as Wed May 31 2017 10:25:*10*. In other words, the closed sprint is registered as completed 4 seconds after the new sprint starts;
* Burndown Chart graph shows a bunch of issues added to the sprint shortly after it began.

h3.Notes:
This also occurs if using a custom start time that occurs within a min of the previous close or a time period before the previous sprints close time.

h3.Workaround

As a workaround, you can start the new sprint in the next minute after the sprint closure.
fields.summary: Close and start sprint date affecting Burndown Chart graph

fields.description:
We would like to have more than 14 colors available for epics in JIRA.

 

Currently the Epic Color field is locked in JIRA.  Please allow users to have more than the standard colors that are currently in Jira Cloud and add new ones to fit their organizations needs.
fields.summary: Ability to add More Epic Colors in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Current Behavior.

Currently, when you clone a task on a board, JIRA will show a pop up, suggesting you to split the issue next time. This is misleading, as the split feature is only available on the backlog view.

h3. Desired Behavior.

The pop up should guide users to switch to the backlog view, or the feature should also be available on the Sprint/Kanban view.
fields.summary: Split issue suggestion pop up misleading.

fields.description: It will be great if we have the ability to create or merge the pull request from JIRA Issue and also be able to add comments to those transitions.
fields.summary: It will be great if we have the ability to create or merge the pull request from JIRA Issue.

fields.description:
When creating a board by existing filter, picklist shows some filters available. However, it could show the favorite filters for that user who's creating the board, which would be more convenient as those are the ones probably used the most by him.

How to reproduce:

 # Go to *Boards > View all boards*
 # Click on *Create Board*
 # Select Board *type*
 # Select *Board from an existing Saved Filter*

*Proposed:*
*Saved filter* picklist could show all user's favorite filters

*Actual:*
*Saved filter* picklist shows some filters but not necessarily all favorites
fields.summary: Filter Picklist when Creating Board by Filter could present users Favorite Filters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The endpoint: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/cloud/#agile/1.0/board-getAllBoards
produces wrong results when used with *type* parameter.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create boards of different types in the environment.
# Use the endpoint above with GET:
For example:
{code}
https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board?type=scrum
{code}

h3. Expected Results
It should provide the list of all boards the user have access to restricted to the type specified.
{code}
{"maxResults":3,"startAt":0,"isLast":true,"values":[{"id":5,"self":"https://theeagle-reborn.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/5","name":"IP board","type":"scrum"}]}
{code}

h3. Actual Results
No error messages, but usually there's no response, or an incorrect one.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: REST /rest/agile/1.0/board produces wrong results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On a board, once all subtasks are moved to 'Done' status, you receive a popup asking to update the parent issue to close it:

!Screen Shot 2017-05-24 at 10.38.40 AM.png!
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to suppress this popup.
h3. Why this is important

For certain cases, it's necessary to leave the parent task opened and it would be helpful if the popup doesn't appear every time.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Provide an option to suppress the "Update Parent Issue" popup

fields.description:
Hi there Atlassian!

We're an SME ISV using the Atlassian cloud solutions.

Currently we've developed a listener that traps webhook calls from Jira. Our jobcosting system creates jobs for every new issue so time can be registered in a proper way.

The issue is that the webhook can't use alternative ports. Only 80 seems to be possible.

Since we run loads of stuff on port 80 we can't also have the JIRA webhook listerner active there.

We have several webhooks from other systems running on alternative ports i hear from my developers, but JIRA is limited to port 80.

Therefore the suggestion i'd like to make is to make it possible to use alternative portnumbers for webhooks.

Hope to see a positive feedback on my request!

Wishing all of you a nice day!

 

Mark Pronk

CEO / President

Modest Automatisering BV
fields.summary: Alternative port for webhook for Jira

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Agile boards cannot be viewed if one of the filter name contains backslash character.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a project ABC
# Create a Scrum board for ABC
# Create a filter with "\" in the name (e.g: filter 23\May) 
# Go to _Boards_ from the navigation bar and view the newly created board and JIRA will throw below error:
#* !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  

h2. Expected behavior
Can view boards with no error

h2. Actual behavior
Cannot view boards due to the backslashes in filter names

h2. Workaround
Remove the backslash characters from the filter name

*Notes*: The error shows on the UI is too generic and it would be great if JIRA could provide more details information on the root cause. 
(!) System Administrator can view the boards.
fields.summary: All Boards cannot be viewed when having backslash character in filter name

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer wants to have the ability to customise how the issues will be presented on his project 
backlog. Instead of only grouping the issues that are on the on the kanban board and the ones that are on the backlog it would be useful to sub-group/group issues by a custom field value or status.

h3. Workaround 
----
fields.summary: Customize Kaban project backlog

fields.description:
for our current sprint, there does not seem to be a guideline in the burndown chart

 

https://phaxio.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&projectKey=PHAX&view=reporting&chart=burndownChart&sprint=20&estimate=field_customfield_10802
fields.summary: no guideline on burndown chart

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

In Scrum board (Active Sprint view), there is a button/link to automatically add a newly created issue to the current Sprint.
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/working-with-sprints/adding-an-issue-to-a-sprint/#AddinganIssuetoaSprint-Creatingandaddinganewissuetoanactivesprint

It would be great if there is a similar feature to do so in Kanban board which will automatically transition it to certain status / move it to certain column.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to automatically add an issue to certain column/status in Kanban board.
fields.summary: A feature to automatically add an issue to certain column/status in Kanban board

fields.description: Would like the Epic Estimate to be the Sum of the Children Issues Estimates.
fields.summary: Epic Estimate = Sum of Children Issue Estimates

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Move to Done button in the active sprint is missing.
h3. Environment
*  Version: JIRA Agile - 1000.475.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a story with a subtask
# Resolve the subtask

h3. Expected Results
Move to Done button appear in line with the issue number
h3. Actual Results
The Move to Done button is missing

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Move to Done button missing

fields.description: In ACTIVE SPRINT the color of the label is gray however in the BACKLOG is black. Besides being a Design Pattern issue it is confusing some customer view. We think it would be gray such as ACTIVE SPRINT.  Follow the images for reference.
fields.summary: Design Pattern problem

fields.description:
Version ordering should be consistent, currently, the Backlog and version fields ("Affected Version" and Fix Version") show the order differently (opposite order) to Releases / Project settings - Versions.

 !versions-opposites.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Version order in Backlog and release fields is inconsistent with order in Releases/Project settings-Versions

fields.description:
We can not choose Style "Block quote" for the new "Comment" in the Issue (when comment section has it default high) - there is to much options in dictionary for "Style" and it does not fit.


In this case, we should be able to expand the Style options menu, depending on our screen configuration.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Expand Comment Style Options up, not down
So simple

fields.description:
Thanks to JSWCLOUD-6175, the kanban backlog allows to prioritize the work that needs to be done; but to have a good overview, it needs to show all of the items that are not yet released to production (aka: completely done).

I.e. do not only show the backlog states; or the "ready for development" states, but also the "in progress" and also the "done" that are still visible on the Working board.

That way, when filtering (on text, by epic, etc.) it shows all of the items that currently are or may (as part of the planning) be added on the work board. 

Examples: if an item is in progress but it is blocked; or it is in progress but turns out to be very large then a replanning is needed. The issue may be split; and some part goes into the backlog; some part is ready for development/in progress. 
Having the ability to see similar issues (matching the filter) that are that are further down in the backlog or done-but-still-on-the-board gives more context for the planning.
fields.summary: As a Kanban PO I would like the Plan mode to show the work in progress
Documentation is wrong for "Export More than 1000 Issues to Excel" page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Download link for firefox bonfire extension is not working.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Capture JIRA add-on in any customer instance.
 # Click on Capture icon in the header -> Get browser extension.
 # it'll points to another site, which one provide the download link
 # Click on it.

h3. Results

Points to this address:
 * http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/bonfire/2.1000/firefox/atlassian-bonfire-latest.xpi

h3. Workaround.
 * Use the link download from JIRA:
 * http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/bonfire/2.9/firefox/atlassian-bonfire-latest.xpi
fields.summary: Download firefox bonfire extension- Capture for JIRA Add-on is unavailable.

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Create a custom field and add it into an agile ticket (e.g.: Single line text: Text field = lol)
 # Create an agile board (no matter which one)
 # Go to: Board > Configure > Card Color
 # Select option Query > Select a color and type:
 {{"Text field" = lol}}
 P.s.: You can also try {{"Text field" = "lol"}}

*Expected Results:*
 On the board, the cards that have this custom field would be with the color that you have previously chosen.

*Actual Results:*
 Nothing happens with the card. No colors changed.

*Workaround:*
 —


*Notes:*
 This does not happen if you choose any JIRA default field, like: assignee, issue type, component, etc. This seems to be only happening to custom fields.
fields.summary: Unable to customize card color when using custom field on JQL

fields.description:
Description

It is possible to cause OOME on JIRA where big number of epics has been created the same summary. One production instance was having OOME because of JQL query which was looking for issues with epic link "Warranty". As we found out customer has created 1600 of such epics. JIRA has created IN query which was trying to match epic link value to every of those issues. Problematic code is here:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkResolver#getEpicLabelOrKeyToEpicIssueIdsOverrideSecurity
com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkResolver#getQueriesForEpicLabelOrKeys
com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkResolver#getQueries
com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkEqualityQueryFactory#handleIn
com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkEqualityQueryFactory#createQueryForSingleValue

{noformat}
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create big number of projects, for example 1000
 # Create epic "X" in every of this project.
 # Link issues in this project to created epics.
 # Run jql query to find issue with epic link = "X"

 
h3. Workaround

Running jql to find epics be issue key.
fields.summary: Searching by epic link with big number of epics causes OOME.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you query the boards using GET /rest/agile/latest/board with the parameter "_type_" (accepting either "_scrum_" or "_kanban_" as types) nothing is returned within "values" in the JSON. It's just empty: _\{"maxResults":50,"startAt":0,"isLast":true,"values":[]}_

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send a GET to /rest/agile/latest/board?type=scrum (or type=kanban)

h3. Expected Results
On the JSON response, within the "values" section, the details of the Scrum boards should be returned.

h3. Actual Results
The "values" section is empty.

h3.Workaround
As a temporary workaround, you can still call /rest/agile/1.0/board to get all boards, then filter by type on the client side.
fields.summary: Can't list boards from certain types using REST API anymore

fields.description:
Days in Column and Days in Status are two different things. One of my teams maps multiples statuses to one column, because our workflow is rather long and we would have too many columns.

On the Agile Board, under Card Layout, there is a checkbox to show Days in Column, but there is no way to show Days in Status on the card. That would be a great feature.
fields.summary: Create a Time in Status feature to be shown on the current sprint board (not backlog)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

All issues that are related to an Epic are appearing on the backlog instead of the sprint they're assigned.
h3. Expected Results

Issues should appear on their assigned sprint.
h3. Actual Results

All issues are appearing on the backlog.
h3. Notes

Trying to move the issues back to their sprints doesn't work.
h3. Workaround

None at this time.

 

Updates are also made available via StatusPage: http://status.atlassian.com/incidents/954zy88q0dy2
fields.summary: Issues with an Epic linked are appearing on the backlog instead of their own sprints.

fields.description:
Ability to scope Priorities to Specific Projects

The basic ability to scope a specific Priority to a specific Project or Issue Type, just like is done with Custom Fields would be great.
This is a specific problem that we have since we have so many teams, that we cannot distill all possible Priorities to one small set that applies to everyone.

 

-Nick
fields.summary: Ability to scope Priorities to Specific Projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there isn't a way to make the Sub-Task automatically transition to the parent status after being created.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create an option to transition the Sub-task automatically to the parent status after being created.

h3. Why this is important
 
This can be useful for some users when they have to add Sub-tasks to break a parent issue up into more steps as they start working on the parent.

h3. Workaround 

Use an add-on like Automation Lite for JIRA Cloud to create a project automation rule.
fields.summary: Sub-Task automatically transition to the parent status after being created

fields.description:
h3. Current Behaviour

When completing a sprint, it's values are updated on the Velocity Chart report. If the board's filter is changed to something that does not include any of the tickets of said report result, they are completely removed from the report. See screen shots for example.

!original-report.png|thumbnail!

!report-changed-after-filter-query.png|thumbnail!

Steps to reproduce:

* Create a board
* Create a few tickets with Estimation
* Put those tickets on the sprint and start it
* Complete a few issues and complete the sprint
* Check the Velocity Chart report. It contains the information regarding the Commitment and Completed values for the Sprint closed
* Change the board filter to filter out some of the issues included on the sprint (I created them with different issue types in order to make the filtering easier)
* Check back the Velocity Chart report and noticed that the initial report data changed.

h3. Expected Behaviour

Reports data consistency is kept and the reports result do not change even after changing the filter board.
fields.summary: Velocity Chart data changes with the board filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When *due* or *duedate* is used on sub-filter, the board is showing blank.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Software Cloud 1000.462.0
 * Kanban Board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Go to *Board Configurations > General*
 * Add *due* or *duedate* to the sub-filter
 * *Back to board*

h3. Expected Results

Issues that meet the filters will be shown
h3. Actual Results

Empty results on the board with the following error on Console Development panel
{noformat}
GET https://example.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json?rapidViewId=1&_=1493711258370 500 ()
	XMLHttpRequest.send	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:70140
send	@	batch.js?locale=en-US:213
ajax	@	batch.js?locale=en-US:207
u	@	batch.js?locale=en-US:1458
j.makeRequest	@	batch.js?locale=en-US:1458
Ajax.makeRequest	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:4470
Ajax._executeGet	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:4403
Ajax.get	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:4256
GH.WorkDataLoader.load	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:32873
GH.WorkDataLoader.getDataForViewId	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:32730
GH.WorkDataLoader.getData	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:32680
GH.WorkController.preload	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:31578
(anonymous)	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:61117
GH.RapidBoard.ViewController.preload	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:61116
(anonymous)	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:12601
j	@	batch.js?locale=en-US:76
add	@	batch.js?locale=en-US:76
(anonymous)	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:12699
GH.RapidBoard.init	@	batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:12698
j	@	batch.js?locale=en-US:76
fireWith	@	batch.js?locale=en-US:77
ready	@	batch.js?locale=en-US:65
Q	@	batch.js?locale=en-US:75
{noformat}
h3. Notes
 * Not all date fields will cause this issue, eg: board is working fine if *createdDate* or *created* is used on sub-filter

h3. Workaround

Remove *due* or *duedate* from the sub-filter
fields.summary: Board Shows Empty/Blank when Due Date is Used on Sub-filter

fields.description: As an Administrator, I would like to have a tool which allows me import data from VivifyScrum in an easy way.
fields.summary: Support import from VivifyScrum

fields.description:
If you add a new issue to the backlog, it’s placed after the latest issue. This is not necessarily the last one in the list. 

The backlog can be sorted manually, disrupting the sorting on issue number.
fields.summary: Backlog - new issues are inserted on issue number (sorting)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Burnup chart considers the old estimation of story points when adding issue to sprint
h3. How to Replicate
* Create a few issues and add them to a sprint
* Start the sprint
* Create a new issue and estimate it
* Click on *Edit* and add the issue to the sprint at the same time as you change the story point estimation.
** Or you can remove the *story points* and then add to the sprint
* Results: Burnup chart will consider the old estimation, while burndown will consider the new one.

h3. Instance Details
N/A

h3. Investigation Done
We just tried reproducing it, not so sure of what's causing it

Please check on it. Thanks.
fields.summary: Burnup chart considers the old estimation of story points when adding issue to sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Status is broken in Swimlane based on Story. Based on [Configuring Swimlane|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-swimlanes-764478010.html], the status is shown completely in the Story.

h3. Affected Version

- JIRA v1000.929.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a board and set the Swimlane to *Story*
# Create some Stories with multiple Subtask

h3. Actual Result

Status is *not* showing completely in the Swimlane.

h3. Expected Result

Status is displayed correctly in each Story.
fields.summary: Status is broken in Swimlane based on Story

fields.description:
It would be easy if the selected quick filter is retained while you open an issue and after that return to the Kanban board.

Our developers work on the issues assigned to them, so filter the Kanban board to 'only my issues. However, when they open an issue to work on it and after finishing want to return to the Kanban board to see what other issues are assigned to them, they see all issues and have to filter again.

Would it be possible to retain the filter that is set for that user and when you reopen the Kanban the filter is still active?
fields.summary: hold the Kanban quick filter after opening an issue
abc
test

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We have a release A and release B. When we complete the release A with unresolved issues and select to move the issues to release B. We can't easily track the issues that once was from release A.
In Sprint, for example, when a ticket is moved from one sprint to the next, the ticket shows a list
of all sprints that ticket has been part of.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a release log where we can track all the issues that once was from the release before the release has been released.
 
h3. Workaround 
Create a JQL filter to check the issue that was from release A:
\{code}
fixVersions was "Release A"
\{code}
fields.summary: Track the issues that were from a previous release

fields.description: We have been using a post-function to make sure no hours remain on the sub-tasks, so when a task is moved to Done the hours are automatically set to zero. Since a few months, there is no way to use this post function in combination with all different flows, so either time logged is not refelcted in the burndown resulting in the burndown not ending at 0 even though all tasks are done, or when we use the post-function earlier in the sequence, time is subtracted twice with a burndown ending below 0 as a result.
fields.summary: Sprint burndown is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Board name displays for a moment after navigating to Board. The glitch would assume that changing board name isn't taking effect.

h3. How to replicate
# Create Kanban Board
# Navigate to Release
# Return to Board

h3. Expected Result
Displays Kanban Board

h3. Actual Result
Displays Name of Board for a short period
 [^Board settings - JIRA - Mozilla Firefox 21-Apr-17 9_35_01 AM.mp4]
fields.summary: Board name displays for a moment after navigating to Board

fields.description:
Hey everyone. I posted the following for a user on my findings about these dots:

!Screen Shot 2017-04-20 at 5.03.14 PM.png|thumbnail!

And I updated this KB: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/configuring-a-board/configuring-columns]

However, this is the one for Cloud: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-columns-764477997.html]
 But it doesn't even mention the "Days in Column" option. But my findings were all on Cloud.

How can this be added to the Cloud doc as it doesn't even mention this feature? Do I edit it or do you?

Thanks.
fields.summary: "Days in Column" dots explanation in our documentation

fields.description: https://twitter.com/benjaminpaton/status/854462341219467264
fields.summary: make existing iPhone app universal so it works on iPad

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When users export an Epic, the export doesn't contain the Issues under the Epic.
 
h3. Suggested Solution

Develop a way to export the Issues too.
 
h3. Why this is important

Users are able to make their reports faster.
 
h3. Workaround

The user can search the Issues linked to that Epic through JQL ("Epic Links = ABC-123")
fields.summary: Export Issues linked to Epic when Exporting the Epic

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the backlog, I want to see the fields on this card in order of
Issue Key - Summary - Assignee...
It's currently not possible to change the order of the default fields in the board.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allows an option to change the order of the default fields displayed in the card of the backlog view.
fields.summary: Add the ability to change the default fields order in the card backlog view

fields.description: Please provide me with your suggestion for {color:#263238}chart/task time dependency extension{color}
fields.summary: I'm looking for chart/task time dependancy extenstion

fields.description:
Would like help demo-ing this software to my dev team.

I do not know enough about the software to demo this and get a buy off on getting them to use it.
fields.summary: Trying to get in touch with a Sales Person

fields.description:
*Story: As a Sprint Board user performing a drag/drop status change, I need to see highlighting on only those statuses which I am permitted to move to, so that I am not confused with unavailable statuses and with a confusing error message (attached).*

Note: JIRA seems to do exactly what I want, always (I love JIRA!), because 10,000 teams before me have come along with the same requirements. I can't believe this requirement here hasn't come up before this ticket. I wonder if this ticket is duplicative OR if there's already a solution.

 

+Acceptance criteria:+ Only the allowable statuses highlight. Same statuses that appear as buttons on the issue screen appear as highlighted columns on drag/drop.

+Long form:+ 

When using drag/drop on a Sprint Board, only those columns that the user is able to use should be highlighted. Those transitions which are unavailable due to workflow conditions should not be highlighted. This should match the buttons presented to the user on the issue screen, where the only buttons displayed are those that are available to the user.

Currently, all existing workflow transitions from the current status seem to be highlighting, including those which exist but which the user is prevented from using based on workflow conditions. That is, those transitions which DO NOT show as buttons on the issue screen DO show as highlighted columns on drag/drop. 

When attempting to drop into one of these non-permitted statuses, the user is presented with an error message that does not match the actual error (screenshot attached).

An alternative short-term fix would be to clarify the error message when dropping to a non-permitted column. I am attaching a screengrab of the current error message, it's confusing to users as it does not indicate the reason for the error, rather it misleads the user.
fields.summary: Highlight only Allowable Columns when Transitioning Issue in a Board using Drag and Drop

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to track if a certain assignee is off-sick during an active sprint. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Insert sick days for users at the *Administration* page.

h3. Why this is important
This will ensure that the team's capacity/velocity is calculated accordingly.
fields.summary: Record sick days during active sprints

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Board not displayed properly when an issue is transitioned and the filter for the board is ORDER BY created or does not have the clause ORDER BY
h3. Environment

JIRA v1000.885.0
 !board display issue.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Kanban Board > use a filter using {{ORDER BY created}}
 # Add Swimlanes based on *Queries*
 # Transition issues under the *Everything Else* swimlane

h3. Expected Results

The board is displayed properly
h3. Actual Results

The *Everything Else* swimlane is shown twice and the issues cards are cut
 * !board display issue.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 - The UI brakes also when the Query in swimlane is:
{code:java}
Sprint in (closedSprints(), openSprints()) and not priority = Highest
{code}

 - Board column headings break when the board filter has below order by clause.
{noformat}
project = CPS ORDER BY createdDate
{noformat}
{noformat}
ORDER BY priority DESC, rank ASC
{noformat}
!Screen Shot 2019-03-18 at 10.12.19 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

having the board ORDER by RANK doesn't have this display error.
fields.summary: Board not displayed properly when issue is transitioned and the filter for the board is ORDER BY created or does not have the clause ORDER BY

fields.description:
Many organizations would like to work with remaining estimations at the sub-task level.

The workload by assignee window at the title of the sprint doesn't take into account a (very common) situation where the story has several sub-tasks, each one assigned on a different assignee.

For that case, the workload by assignee is *totally wrong* and doesn't enable easy planning of the sprint. Workaround is to use all kind of dashboard gadgets to calculate the total remaining estimation at the sub-task level, but this is not a very good workaround, since it is separate from the backlog view of the board.

+*Example:*+ 
 * Story A, original estimate 20h, remaining estimate 0h, Assigned on User A
 *     Sub-task A1, original estimate 10h, remaining estimate 12h, assigned on user A
 *     Sub-task A2, original estimate 10h, remaining estimate 15h, assigned on user B

*+Expected result:+*

when viewing the workload by assignee, it should show:
 * User A: Original estimate: 20h, remaining estimate 12h (original estimate should be calculated only from the stories, not the sub-tasks)
 * User B: Original estimate: 0h, remaining estimate 15h (original estimate should be calculated only from the stories, not the sub-tasks)

+*Actual result:*+

when viewing the workload by assignee, it shows: (takes into account only stories, not sub-tasks)
 * User A: Original estimate: 20h, remaining estimate 0h
 * User B: Original estimate: 0h, remaining estimate 0h
fields.summary: Take into Account sub-tasks when calculating the Workload by Assignee

fields.description:
h2. Summary

The Sprint Burndown report doens't count issues if their history have two workflow transitions to done that occurred in the exact same second.

h2. Expected Result

The Report should consider the issues to be completed and deduct the Story points.

h2. Current Result

The Report doesn't recognize such issues as valid issues.

h2. Workaround

No available.
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown report doesn't count issues with duplicated Workflow transitions

fields.description:
Currently there is no way to add a custom field that will display a time or duration.  Closest thing is a Number custom field which only takes integers or decimals.  We need something similar to the Original Estimate field as part of the Time Tracking feature.

+Use Case:+

Want to add a "Baseline Estimate" field that we would like to compare with the Time Tracking Original Estimate field that is already there.  If we could add this as a custom field then we could have the data and then run searches or reports as comparison.

Workaround:

None currently.  There are also no plugins available in the Cloud version that extend the custom field options.
fields.summary: Ability to add a Time/Duration Custom Field
